trans-unit.source: Authoring a DSC resource in C
trans-unit.target: Authoring a DSC resource in C

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: Typically, a Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) custom resource is implemented in a PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: Typically, a Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) custom resource is implemented in a PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also implement the functionality of a DSC custom resource by writing cmdlets in C#.
trans-unit.target: However, you can also implement the functionality of a DSC custom resource by writing cmdlets in C#.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction on writing cmdlets in C#, see <link><linkText>Writing a Windows PowerShell Cmdlet</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an introduction on writing cmdlets in C#, see <link><linkText>Writing a Windows PowerShell Cmdlet</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Aside from implementing the resource in C# as cmdlets, the process of creating the MOF schema, creating the folder structure, importing and using your custom DSC resource are the same as described in <link><linkText>Writing a custom DSC resource with MOF</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Aside from implementing the resource in C# as cmdlets, the process of creating the MOF schema, creating the folder structure, importing and using your custom DSC resource are the same as described in <link><linkText>Writing a custom DSC resource with MOF</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Writing a cmdlet-based resource
trans-unit.target: Writing a cmdlet-based resource

trans-unit.source: For this example, we will implement a simple resource that manages a text file and its contents.
trans-unit.target: For this example, we will implement a simple resource that manages a text file and its contents.

trans-unit.source: Writing the MOF schema
trans-unit.target: Writing the MOF schema

trans-unit.source: The following is the MOF resource definition.
trans-unit.target: The following is the MOF resource definition.

trans-unit.source: Setting up the Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: Setting up the Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: Setting up a cmdlet project
trans-unit.target: Setting up a cmdlet project

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Create a C# project and provide the name.
trans-unit.target: Create a C# project and provide the name.

trans-unit.source: Select Class Library from the available project templates.
trans-unit.target: Select Class Library from the available project templates.

trans-unit.source: Click Ok.
trans-unit.target: Click Ok.

trans-unit.source: Add an assembly reference to System.Automation.Management.dll to your project.
trans-unit.target: Add an assembly reference to System.Automation.Management.dll to your project.

trans-unit.source: Change the assembly name to match the resource name.
trans-unit.target: Change the assembly name to match the resource name.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the assembly should be named MSFT_XDemoFile.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the assembly should be named MSFT_XDemoFile.

trans-unit.source: Writing the cmdlet code
trans-unit.target: Writing the cmdlet code

trans-unit.source: The following C# code implements the Get-TargetResource, Set-TargetResource, and Test-TargetResource cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: The following C# code implements the Get-TargetResource, Set-TargetResource, and Test-TargetResource cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: Deploying the resource
trans-unit.target: Deploying the resource

trans-unit.source: The compiled dll file should be saved in a file structure similar to a script-based resource.
trans-unit.target: The compiled dll file should be saved in a file structure similar to a script-based resource.

trans-unit.source: The following is the folder structure for this resource.
trans-unit.target: The following is the folder structure for this resource.
